name: 6-[bis(5-ethylfuran-2-yl)methyl]-7-nitro-2,3-dihydro-1,4-benzodioxine
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-2671
Reason: 6-[bis(5-ethylfuran-2-yl)methyl]-7-nitro-2,3-dihydro-1,4-benzodioxine has a complex structure with multiple functional groups. Starting with the base of benzene, which has a melting point of 5.5 °C, we have substantial structural components to consider. The furan ring itself raises the melting point due to increased molecular rigidity and pi-stacking interactions, estimated at around +20 °C. The nitro group introduces a strong withdrawing group, which can increase the melting point by approximately +50 °C. The ethyl groups can also contribute to the melting point due to their additional molecular weight and possible hydrogen bonding, estimated at around +5 °C each. The dioxane-like bridging moiety can add rigidity and contribute more significantly than a simple ether, estimated at around +5 °C for this structural feature.
